definition: lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Love is the smile had to drink the poisoned wine, Later he was driven, never regret.
sentences.chinese: 愛情原來是含笑飲毒酒，肝腸寸斷，永不言悔。

sentences.english: A look at the intestines, good to go back to the mo.
sentences.chinese: 回頭看一次就肝腸寸斷，好好離去吧，不要再回頭了。
那條消息使她肝腸寸斷。

sentences.english: To watch me, while I bleed?
The death of his wife broke him completely.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子逝世使他肝腸寸斷。

sentences.english: Even if your heart, but also for the original decision.
sentences.chinese: 哪怕你肝腸寸斷，也要爲當初的決定付出代價。

sentences.english: They suffered the heartbreak of losing a child through cancer.
sentences.chinese: 他們因癌症奪去了一個孩子而肝腸寸斷。

sentences.english: Nancy and I are pained to the core by the tragedy of the shuttle Challenger.
sentences.chinese: “挑戰者號”航天飛機的悲劇令南希和我肝腸寸斷。

sentences.english: I had never witnessed such disabling grief.
sentences.chinese: 我還從未見過她如此肝腸寸斷。

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to revisit old haunts (idiom); down memory lane
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to miss/to yearn day and night
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
